trans-unit.source: Once we have identified that SQL Server process is consuming CPU, we have to next find which inside SQL Server process is consuming this CPU.

trans-unit.source: <run1>Note</run1>: If your server is under severe stress and you are unable to login to SSMS, you can use another machine’s SSMS to login to the server through DAC.

trans-unit.source: This <run1>DMV</run1> can help us to <run2>Returns aggregate performance statistics</run2> for cached query plans in SQL Server and identify those process using more Total Worker time. Performance statistics gone when SQL Server is restarted.

trans-unit.source: <run1>Ring Buffer </run1>help to find SQL Server and system CPU usage history: <run2>Max last 256 Minutes. </run2>If CPU Spikes is caused by other application involve App team.
